snippet: Deploying community health workers to treat sick children rapidly can make an enormous difference in how many live and how many die, according to a study done in Mali.
abstract: Study conducted by Dr Ari D Johnson in Mali and published in journal PLoS One finds that deploying community health workers to treat sick children rapidly can make an enormous difference in child mortality rates.
lead_paragraph: Deploying community health workers to treat sick children rapidly can make an enormous difference in how many live and how many die, according to a study done in Mali.

headline.main: A Simple Community Health Remedy in Mali
headline.print_headline: Prevent And Treatment: A Simple Remedy in Mali
